title: How to Take CBD Oil for Fibromyalgia

steps.headline: Rub a topical CBD massage oil over areas that feel painful.
steps.description: Massage oils may relieve pain at the site for some people. Topical CBD products usually include a carrier such as coconut oil or beeswax to make it easy to apply. Apply a dollop of oil to your fingertips, then massage it into your skin. Make circular motions along your skin as you massage yourself.CBD oil may provide immediate pain relief, but it’s common for the product to take 30 minutes to work. Keep in mind that not everyone notices the effects of CBD oil, so it might not work for you. If you don’t notice effects from the first product you try, switch to a different CBD massage oil to see if it works for you.Tip: Since massage may help relieve your fibromyalgia symptoms, using CBD oil to massage yourself may increase the benefits of both of these alternative treatments.

steps.headline: Use a CBD oil tincture for pain relief throughout your body.
steps.description: CBD oil tinctures can provide relief in as little as 15-30 minutes if they work for you. Use the eyedropper that came with your CBD oil to measure out 1-2 drops of oil. Then, squeeze the drops under your tongue and hold them in place for 30 seconds before swallowing.Some tinctures come in a spray bottle. If you’re using a spray, apply 1 spritz to the inside of each cheek. Look for a CBD oil tincture at a drugstore, dispensary, or online. Tinctures often come in flavors to make them tastier, so look for a flavor that you enjoy.Variation: If you hate the taste of your tincture, it’s okay to mix 1-2 drops of tincture into a glass of water or your favorite non-alcoholic beverage. Then, drink all of the beverage as quickly as you can. It’ll take at least 30 minutes to feel the effects.

steps.headline: Take CBD capsules 1-3 times per day to manage your pain.
steps.description: CBD capsules are an easy way to get all-over relief. Purchase CBD capsules at your local drugstore, dispensary, or online. Then, read the label and take your CBD as directed.You likely won’t notice symptom relief until 30-90 minutes have passed. The capsules need to pass through your digestive system, which takes time. Keep in mind that some CBD oil will be lost during digestion, so you may need to take a higher dose when using CBD capsules.

steps.headline: Vape CBD oil to help instantly relieve your pain and relax.
steps.description: Smoking is the quickest way to feel the effects of CBD oil. A vape pen is the easiest, and possibly safest, way to smoke the oil. Attach a CBD oil cartridge to a vape pen battery. Then, follow the instructions on your vape pen battery to inhale a puff of CBD smoke.You might feel symptom relief in as little as 30 seconds after puffing on your vape pen. You can purchase a vape pen battery and CBD oil cartridge at your local smoke shop, dispensary, or online. A vape pen battery is the base of the pen, which attaches to the cartridge that holds what you’re smoking.Warning: Vaping might be damaging to your lungs and respiratory system. There’s some scientific evidence that suggests it may also cause shortness of breath and chest pain.

steps.headline: Experiment with CBD edibles to see if they help you.
steps.description: Edibles are a fun way to take CBD oil, but they typically take a long time to work. Additionally, you might not get the same dose each time, and some of the CBD oil may be lost in the digestive process. Try CBD edibles if you prefer the flavor and convenience of them to see if they work for you.You may notice pain relief and relaxation in 2-4 hours after eating CBD edibles. You can purchase edibles at a dispensary or online. Sample different types of edibles. Some may work better than others, as everybody is different.

steps.headline: Ask your doctor to recommend the correct dose for you.
steps.description: Your doctor can recommend the safest dose for you to try. Tell them that you’re trying to relieve your fibromyalgia symptoms, then ask how much of the product you should use. They may also recommend a product to try.Discuss your chosen delivery method, as well. Your doctor can help you decide if this is the safest option for you.

steps.headline: Follow the dosing recommendations on your product.
steps.description: Most CBD products include dosage recommendations on the packaging. Since each product is different, the correct dosage for you can vary. Read the label to get the right dose for the product you’re currently using.Don’t exceed the product’s recommended dose, even if it doesn’t work for you. If a product isn’t working, try a different product rather than taking too much of it.

steps.headline: Estimate your dose by taking 1 to 6 mg per 10 pounds (4.5 kg) of body weight.
steps.description: Start by dividing your weight in pounds by 10. Then, use this number as your starting dose. If it doesn’t work for you, try multiplying that number by 2. Continue to increase the dose until you’ve multiplied this number by 6, which is your maximum recommended dose.As an example, let’s say you weigh 150 pounds (68 kg). Divide 150/10 = 15. Start with a dosage of 15 mg. If this doesn’t work, multiply 15 x 2 = 30 mg. To find your highest recommended dose, you’d multiply 15 x 6 = 90 mg.

steps.headline: Use an online CBD dosage calculator to find the best dose.
steps.description: For a convenient calculation, do an online search for CBD oil dosage calculators. Then, enter the number of mL in your product container, the mg of CBD the product contains, and your weight. The calculator will give you a recommended dose for the product.If you buy the CBD oil online, use the calculator on the website you’re using, if there is one to get the most accurate dose.

steps.headline: Stick to the lowest dose that provides you relief.
steps.description: Everyone has their own best dose of CBD oil, so you’ll probably need to experiment to find yours. Start with the smallest dose for your product. If you don’t get the results you want, increase your dose and see if that works for you.For instance, you might start with 1 puff on your vape pen, 1 drop of tincture, 1 bite of edibles, or 1-2 capsules. Generally, 10 mg is a safe place to start.

methods.name: Making Lifestyle Changes to Support Your Care

steps.headline: Incorporate stress relievers into your day to minimize your symptoms.
steps.description:
Although stress is a normal part of life, too much stress may trigger or worsen your fibromyalgia symptoms. To help manage your condition, try out different stress relievers to see what works for you. Then, incorporate stress relievers into your day. Here are some great options:
Meditate for 10 minutes. Color in an adult coloring book. Talk to a friend. Play with your pet. Take a warm bath. Engage in a hobby. Spend time outdoors.

steps.headline: Exercise for 30 minutes a day to help manage your symptoms.
steps.description: Talk to your doctor before you start exercising to make sure it’s right for you. If your doctor says it’s okay, do 30 minutes of light to moderate exercise most days to improve your fitness levels and help control your symptoms.For instance, go for a brisk walk, swim, dance, or take an aerobics class.

steps.headline: Follow a sleep routine to help you get 7-9 hours of sleep.
steps.description: Fibromyalgia causes fatigue, so resting is important. However, your fibromyalgia might also make it hard to sleep. Stick to a sleep schedule so your body is used to going to bed at the same time each day. Additionally, turn off screens at least an hour before bed and relax.For instance, you might go to bed at 10 p.m. every night and wake up at 6:00 a.m. At 9:00 p.m. every day, you might turn off all of your screens, take a warm shower, put on pajamas, and read a chapter of a book in bed.

steps.headline: Slow down your activities to make things easier on you.
steps.description: Pacing yourself might help you avoid triggering symptoms like pain, stiffness, and fatigue. Take your time when you’re doing tasks, such as cleaning or making dinner. This might help you control your symptoms.Ask for help when you need it. It’s better to get help than to push yourself too hard.

steps.headline: Eat a healthy diet to nourish your body.
steps.description: Fill your plate with vegetables, fruits, lean protein, and complex carbs. These foods will nourish your body and help reduce inflammation. On the other hand, limit or cut out processed foods, sweets, and high-fat meats that might worsen your inflammation. This may help you reduce your symptoms.Lean proteins include chicken, turkey, fish, tofu, beans, low-fat dairy, nuts, and meat replacements. Complex carbohydrates include starchy vegetables and whole grains.

steps.headline: Check with your doctor before using CBD oil.
steps.description: While CBD oil is generally safe, it’s not right for everyone. It may worsen certain health conditions and could interfere with your medications. Talk to your doctor before trying CBD oil to make sure it’s right for you.Tell your doctor that you want to use CBD oil to help manage your fibromyalgia.

steps.headline: Ask your doctor about other treatments if CBD oil doesn’t help you.
steps.description: While CBD oil may help you, it doesn’t work the same way for everyone. If you don’t get the relief you want, talk to your doctor about other treatment options. You might be able to try the following treatments:Over-the-counter nonsteroidal inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) like ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin) and naproxen (Aleve) may help manage your pain and inflammation. Antidepressants may ease your pain and fatigue while also helping you sleep. Certain anti-seizure medications may help manage your pain.

steps.headline: Call your doctor if you experience any side effects from CBD oil.
steps.description:
While it’s uncommon, you might experience side effects while using CBD oil. Usually, side effects occur when you use a high dose of the oil. Generally, these side effects will be mild and should go away quickly. However, consult your doctor if you experience the following side effects:Dry mouth
Diarrhea
Reduced appetite
Drowsiness
Fatigue
